subject: RE: [junit] REQ: Pro side of "use inner classes to test  private stuff"
msgSnippet: ... Agreed, however if you assume that testing private parts is a necessity, then cluttering up the source code is not good. The necessity comes from the
messageBody:
>So said Ilja Preuss on 2003-08-07 --------------------
>J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>> I am looking for opinions on the pro side of using inner
>> classes to test the private parts of a class. Since I don't
>> use the technique myself, I don't know whether there is any
>> advantage to this technique, other than it works. (I could
>> also use JUnitX without cluttering up my source code.)
>
>To me, cluttering up the source code *is* an advantage in this case.
>Testing private parts is a smell - if I need to do it, I want the smell
>to be felt every time I need to work with it, I want it to be ugly.

Agreed, however if you assume that testing private parts is a necessity, then cluttering up the source code is not good. The necessity comes from the desire to add tests to legacy code to aid in refactoring.

Given that, any further comments?
